articles.author: Aayush Gupta
articles.description:
In this tutorial, you will build an NFT gallery using QuickNode's GraphQL NFT API, Icy.tools, React, JavaScript, Next.js, Vercel, and TailwindCSS. The React web app will provide a user interface displaying a grid view of all the NFTs held by any Ethereum Name Service (ENS). You will fetch NFT data with icy-nft-tools.

What is QuickNode?
QuickNode is a blockchain platform that provides infrastructure for developers to build and scale decentralized applications (DApps). It offers a suite of tools and services, including a developer API, to make it easier for developers to build, test, and deploy DApps on multiple blockchain networks. QuickNode aims to simplify the building process on blockchain and make it more accessible for developers while providing high-performance infrastructure to supp…
articles.title: How to Build an NFT Gallery Using QuickNode's GraphQL NFT API

articles.author: Narbeh Shahnazarian
articles.description:
🌈 GM
In this week's episode of DevNTell, DAO member Gery Pollak gives us an updated look at Blocktorch: an observability platform that helps builders understand the behavior of a decentralized application holistically.
🌟 Developer Spotlight
Gery has 6 years of experience working in business development at FAANG and investing in startups in central & eastern Europe as a VC. He is a self-taught developer (CS50) who made his first steps in solidity development end of 2020 going through the likes of CryptoZombies, Ethernaut, DappUnivserity etc. Beginning of 2022 (at the time when he joined D_D 🙂 ) he started to work on Blocktorch together with his co-founder Amine who is a seasoned software engineer.
🔥 About Blocktorch
From the About page of Blocktorch:
The number of decentralized applications, their developers as well as users are growing at rapid speed, yet the tooling around web3 is not evolving fast enough. The underlying decentralized architecture is getting more complex and less understandable. To ensure web3 is mass market ready reliability is key.  The talented engineering teams pushing the frontiers of innovation need the best tools to build the best products.  
We at Blocktorch are re-imagining how developers build and maintain their decentralized applications. We believe in empowering every software engineering team to gain a deeper understanding of their smart contracts as well as other decentralized components such that they can troubleshoot and resolve anomalies in minutes, not hours.
Website: blocktorch.xyz
Twitter: twitter.com/blocktorch
Gery's Twitter: twitter.com/GeryPollak
Gery's Discord handle: CapG(blocktorch.xyz)#9916
🎥 Presentation



https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=stpQ3_Atfnw
articles.title: DevNTell - Blocktorch (beta)

articles.author: Patrick Skinner
articles.description:
In this comprehensive tutorial, we'll walk through the process of building a token-gated community for live concerts using QuickNode. We will create a custom token on the Ethereum network, develop a smart contract for the community, and design a frontend interface using QuickNode's API. This platform will allow concert organizers to offer exclusive live concert access to token holders.
Prerequisites
Basic understanding of Ethereum, Solidity, and smart contracts
Familiarity with JavaScript and web development
Node.js and npm installed on your local machine
MetaMask or another Ethereum-compatible wallet

Step 1: Setting up the project
As our first step, we will create a smart contract in Solidity for the token we later use for the gating.
1.1 Installing dependencies
To begin, make sure you h…
articles.title: Building a Tokengated Community for Live Concerts with QuickNode: A Step-by-Step Tutorial

articles.author: Aayush Gupta
articles.description:
In this tutorial, you will learn how to migrate your DApp from Goerli to Sepolia using QuickNode, a fast and reliable RPC node provider. 
As you may know, the Goerli network has faced several issues recently, from the low availability of test funds to network downtime. Considering this, it makes perfect sense to take your testing from Goerli to Sepolia.
1. Updating the RPC node
The first step for migrating your DApp is to get the RPC node of the new test network. For our example, we will use the Sepolia test network and QuickNode as the node provider.
Go to their RPC Endpoints Service section by clicking on this link and click on the "Create an endpoint" button.

Select the chain. In our case, we will be selecting Ethereum.

Select the network, and click "continue".

Click on the "Create e…
articles.title: How to Migrate a DApp from Goerli to Sepolia Using QuickNode

articles.author: Alexander Sack
articles.description:
In Part I of Decoding Decentralization, we framed Ethereum (and all blockchains really) as a distributed decentralized database.
We then used the change-data capture design pattern to replay all transfer events of a given smart contract.
By capturing those events through the log entries they create, we could aggregate them and determine how many Murakami Flower NFTs a given wallet address has, or which holder wallets constitute a whale, etc.
In Part II, I want to dive deeper into the interaction between blocks, transactions, and the log entries they create, as well as the process of log ABI translation which is critical for any chain-based analytics.

The State of the Chain Address
If we think of Ethereum as a gigantic database that manages the state, just like all traditional databases, t…
articles.title: Decoding Decentralization

articles.author: Erik Knobl
articles.description:
As you navigate the world of synthography, as the new format of creating images with artificial intelligence tools has been named, with virtual storytelling tools like Midjourney, DALL.E, and Adobes Firefly, one crucial aspect to consider is how you prompt camera angles.
Camera angles are a crucial tool in filmmaking, photography, and synthography, that can make or break a scene, setting the tone and creating the desired mood for the audience.

In this blog post, well cover the best practices of prompting four standard camera angles in Midjourney:
The eye-level angle
The low angle
The high angle
The Dutch angle
Eye-Level Angle

Prompt: Man is making a walk in a forest near a bright colored sky, in the style of graphic design-inspired illustrations, 32k UHD, colorful cartoon, smokey backgro…
articles.title: Mastering Midjourney: Camera Angles

articles.author: Narbeh Shahnazarian
articles.description:
In this week's episode of DevNTell we were joined by Co-Founders Kirsten and Romain who gave us an overview of TalentLayer.
🌟 Developer Spotlight
Kirsten is a co-founder and Executive Lead of TalentLayer. She's a college dropout, self-taught dev, and freelancer who's now leading the open-source movement behind TalentLayer. She spent the past 4 years consulting on various enterprise blockchain projects and an NFT marketplace SDK startup.
Romain is the co-founder and the Technical Lead of TalentLayer. He led the team behind Europe's biggest sports data infra company for 6 years. He has spent the past 4 years experimenting and building teams and blockchain projects.
🔥 About TalentLayer
From the TalentLayer Docs:
TalentLayer is infrastructure for open service markets; backend tooling for building interoperable marketplaces that leverage an on-chain liquidity pool of users and services.
TalentLayer provides core tooling for building marketplaces including:
On-chain jobs and proposals
Soul-bound identity and reviews
Configurable escrow capable of supporting milestone, lump sum, hourly pay and more
Decentralized and platform-managed dispute resolution options
Configurable fees system enabling fees on escrow transactions, job posts, proposal submissions, dispute resolution
Resources
Website: https://www.talentlayer.org/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/talentlayer
GitHub: https://github.com/TalentLayer
LinkTree: https://linktr.ee/talentlayer
Kirsten's Twitter: https://twitter.com/kirstenrpomales
Romain's Twitter: https://twitter.com/Romain__TL
🎥 Presentation



https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5r0idv7TTeU
articles.title: DevNTell - TalentLayer

articles.author: Narbeh Shahnazarian
articles.description:
In this week's episode of DevNTell we were joined by Gilad who gave us an overview of 0xCord. In this presentation, Gilad demos how to use 0xCord with Chainlink VRF V2 both on-chain and off-chain.
🌟 Developer Spotlight
Gilad studied computer science at Columbia and has been writing solidity code for the past 5 years. Hes currently working on 0xCord, a web3 infra hub for developers.
🔥 About 0xCord
0xCord.com is a web3 infra hub for developers. It's the easiest way to access web3 infrastructure via native payments, composability, and configuration, all in one unified place. With 0xCord's off-chain API, you can easily consume the Chainlink VRF V2 through a simple RESTful JSON API call, bridging the gap between web2 and decentralized web3 infrastructure. [Source]
Resources
Website: https://0xcord.com/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/0xCord
Gilad's Twitter: https://twitter.com/freeslugs
Hello World tutorial: https://mirror.xyz/0x055ebddE8fC573C24bB986deaE0EF1E2328f60E7/z2d4xbhoAl_-k2_yJGLErOAGt-C48qezq1AmAgtczq0
🎥 Presentation



https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4UDhSaP9zZ8
articles.title: DevNTell - 0xCord

articles.author: Franklin Ohaegbulam
articles.description:
Do you want to master blockchain technology and smart contract development on networks like Ethereum, Polygon, Celo, Solana, and more? Look no further! I've curated a list of FREE learning websites and courses just for you.
In this article, I'll take you through the top resources and platforms to help you understand how blockchain works and how to build and deploy smart contracts. Whether considering a career switch or just looking to expand your knowledge, these resources offer hands-on experience and free NFTs and Certificates upon completion. Don't miss this opportunity to level up your skills and become a blockchain pro! Let's dive in.
1. Ethereum.org
Ethereum.org is the community-run technology powering the cryptocurrency Ethereum and thousands of decentralized applications. This plat…
articles.title: 40 Free Online Learning Platforms for Web3 Enthusiasts

articles.author: Narbeh Shahnazarian
articles.description:
In this week's episode of DevNTell we were joined by Chakra who gave us an overview of the Spect Network's Web3 Forms
🌟 Developer Spotlight
Chakra is a software engineer who got into the builder web3 scene back in 2021 predominantly focusing on backend development. Around that same time, one of his closest friends with a frontend background had also begun building in the web3 space. In an "aha" moment, they soon realized they had the makings of a great team which led them to found Spect
🔥 About Spect's Web3 Forms
From Spects docs:
Spect helps DAO contributors form circles that manage grants, bounties, onboarding and projects. Spects web3 forms help web3 organizations create the best onboarding, feedback & survey experience for contributors.
Resources
Website: https://circles.spect.network/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/JoinSpect

articles.author: Megabyte
articles.description:
gm gm gm!!!
Indeed, in the current scenario, few NFT marketplaces cater to non-web3 users, primarily due to the poor User Experience (UX) they have to face.
A significant barrier to entry for these users is the complexity of the Web3 ecosystem, including the need to understand concepts such as wallets, private keys, and gas fees. Moreover, the onboarding process can be tedious and confusing, with users having to set up and manage wallets and acquire cryptocurrency to interact with the marketplace. To address these issues and make NFT marketplaces more accessible to non-web3 users, it's essential to focus on improving UX.
In this guide, youll learn how to create a marketplace on Polygon and make it easy for non-crypto natives to use the marketplace by allowing them to log in with their emai…
articles.title: How to build Reddit's NFT Marketplace using Polygon and Paper 📄
